title: Global Wealth Solutions - Investor Relations Associate

pay_input_ranges.title: Base Salary Range
pay_input_ranges.blurb: This is the expected annual base salary range for this New York-based position. Actual salaries may vary based on factors, such as skill, experience, and qualification for the role. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus, based on factors such as individual and team performance.

content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. TEAM OVERVIEW
The Global Client Solutions Group ("KCS") is KKR's dedicated investor solutions team. KCS, formerly known as the Client and Partner Group, or CPG, was first formed in 2009 to invest in and focus on KKR's relationships with current and potential investors. KKR's Global Wealth Solutions team, formerly known as Private Wealth Partners or PWP, is the part of KCS that is specifically focused on the firm's wealth distribution strategy and goals. 
 
POSITION SUMMARY
The KKR Global Wealth Solutions team seeks to recruit an experienced professional to focus on investor relations for registered and private products across alternative asset classes in the US.  The ideal candidate will bring deep knowledge of registered and private fund administration and onboarding and platform (private banks, wirehouses, RIAs and independent broker/dealers) operational processes.  They will also deliver strong relationships across third party service providers (such as transfer agents and administrators) and their counterparts at our platform partners. This individual will work seamlessly within the Global Wealth Solutions business, supporting financial advisors and their relationship managers in set territories, as well as liaise frequently with the finance, investment, product, and legal/compliance teams of each of the relevant businesses at KKR.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES

Field inquiries from Financial Advisors, Investors & internal stakeholders regarding KKR investment offerings
Support operational onboarding and implementation of KKR offerings on platforms (private banks, wirehouses, RIAs, custodians, third party providers and independent broker/dealers)
Collaborate with Strategic Accounts and product teams in setting offering specifications, distribution terms and the review of selling agreements
Assist in the structuring, registration and launch of registered product to ensure compatibility with platforms and third party vendors; with a particular focus on order entry, funding/cash flows and liquidity mechanisms
Help oversee and manage our relationships with third party service providers (transfer agents, administrators, custodians, outside counsel and financial printers)
Develop strong understanding of distribution partners’ operational platforms and processes and become resident KKR expert for Advisor and KKR inquiries
Liaise with KKR investment teams, finance and third party transfer agents relating to client inquiries, problem resolution and reconciliation
Work with legal and compliance to ensure adherence to key regulatory requirements and periodic filings such as prospectus supplements
Assist in ad hoc projects / research to support GWS business initiatives

 
QUALIFICATIONS

At least 5 years of experience in investor relations and onboarding
Comprehensive knowledge of alternatives, with an emphasis on private markets products
Proven expertise in the ongoing product management of alternative funds targeted at Accredited Investors and Qualified Purchasers
Extensive experience and an ability to develop relationships with private wealth platforms and fund service providers, including private banks, wirehouses, RIAs and independent broker/dealers as well as fund administrators, transfer agents and custodians
Excellent academic credentials including an undergraduate degree
Strong computer and Excel skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Series 7 License (preferred)

#LI-DNIThis is the expected annual base salary range for this New York-based position. Actual salaries may vary based on factors, such as skill, experience, and qualification for the role. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus, based on factors such as individual and team performance.Base Salary Range$150,000—$175,000 USDKKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
